alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 9:37PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Scott, Carver, Dakota and Hennepin Counties. Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Yellow Medicine, Renville and Chippewa Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Yellow Medicine, Lac qui Parle and Chippewa Counties. Minnesota River at Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. .Showers and thunderstorms have produced a decent amount of rainfall in spots today, however not widespread enough to cause any issues with our downwards trend in river levels. We expect to continue to see a downward trend despite further showers through the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Montevideo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Low lying areas and some roads along the river begin flooding, along with some basements of houses along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 15.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 PM CDT Friday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 14.3 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.2 feet on 04/03/2020. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine
